column4: How do I check if these are installed on my computer: XFree86-Mesa-libGL, libstdc++, libgcc, XFree86-libs, fontconfig, freetype, zlib, ggc, glibc version 2.2 or 2.3
apt-cache policy packagename
it says "W: Unable to locate package libstdc++"
ubottu> Package libstdc++ does not exist in lucid
so how do i install it?
im running karmic
try apt-cache search libstdc++ | less
libstdc++6 is in lucid
it says i need all those packges to make my graphic drivers work
ok install them
what does apt-cache search libstdc++ | less return?
it shows http://pastebin.com/QfnQBUf1
ok then. install libstdc++6
libstdc++6 is already the newest version. so its already installed?
yes
what is telling you to install those packages?
graphic card manufacture of ATI Radeon HD 5770
why are you trying to compile?
the problem is my CPU usage is always high, when i move around windows in Ubuntu
my graphic card proprtary drivers
look in system > administration > hardware drivers does it offer drivers?
and MrElendig: yes but when i installed them i get a green AMD icon in the right corner of the screen saying "unsupported hardware".
sorry but I don't compile my drivers. I do know that you need to install build-essential if you are going to compile anything. apt-cache policy build-essential
